item.title: Trump Brings Out the Worst in Everyone
item.description: Us included.

item.title: Heads? MAGA Wins. Tails? I Win.
item.description: A law that just might save the midterms.

item.title: Why Ending Roe Wasn’t Enough for the Pro-Life Movement
item.description: Activists won the legal battle. Are they losing the culture war?

item.title: I Was Arrested for Doing My Job as a Reporter. Who’s Next?
item.description: I covered the Minnesota church protest. Press credentials didn’t protect me.

item.title: Maureen Dowd and Carlos Lozada on the Empty Propaganda of ‘Melania’
item.description: Glamour, silence and a very big hat.

item.title: A Gilded Age Illusion: What ‘Melania’ Is Really Selling
item.description: The columnists decode ‘Melania’ — the film and the person.

item.title: It’s Not the Cartels That Worry Claudia Sheinbaum
item.description: Trump wants total war on Mexico’s cartels. Sheinbaum won’t give it to him.

item.title: I’m the Prime Minister of Spain. This Is Why the West Needs Migrants.
item.description: In Spain, it is our duty to become the welcoming and tolerant society our ancestors would have hoped to find on the other side of our borders.

item.title: ICE’s Surveillance State Isn’t Tracking Only Immigrants
item.description: The nationwide nativist dragnet has a long list of targets.

item.title: What a Baby’s Laugh Actually Tells Us
item.description: A kid’s first joke reveals a complex mind.

item.title: This Is the Real Reason Susie Wiles Talked to Me 11 Times
item.description: What did her unguarded remarks reveal about the Trump White House?

item.title: The Risk We Face in Opposing Trump
item.description: People often misunderstand nonviolent protest. It is not merely eschewing violence.

item.title: Erasing American History, the Trump Way
item.description: Readers object to the National Park Service’s deletions at historic sites ordered by the Trump administration. Also: David Brooks’s farewell column.

item.title: Nurses Face Horrific Violence at Work. We’re Striking to Change That.
item.description: Thousands of New York nurses are on strike. They’re demanding protections to stay safe in the face of a wave of workplace violence.

item.title: How the Justice Department Failed Epstein’s Victims — Again
item.description: Molly Jong-Fast argues that the Trump administration’s sloppy release of the Epstein files is more than just incompetence; it’s a betrayal of the victims.

item.title: Common Ground Is for Suckers
item.description: Some are more American than others.

item.title: Much of Silicon Valley Remains Mum About Minneapolis. Here’s Why.
item.description: In a shaky job market, Silicon Valley workers feel they lack the leverage needed to make their political views known.

item.title: Welcome to the Resistance, Public School Parents
item.description: School communities are central to organizing against federal harassment.

item.title: What if Labor Becomes Unnecessary?
item.description: Three economists debate the effects that artificial intelligence is having on the job market.

item.title: In Counting the Dead in Iran, a Picture of Ferocity
item.description: The high number of dead and wounded demonstrates the depths of the regime’s fears.

item.title: Icemageddon, Southern Style
item.description: An ice storm will bring a city like Nashville to its knees.

item.title: Will Newsom Be the Democrats’ Next Mistake?
item.description: The California governor’s record is exactly what Republicans want to run against.

item.title: In Ohio, I Caught a Glimpse of the New Resistance
item.description: It’s not just blue America where people are readying themselves for disaster.

item.title: What Is the Democrats’ Game Plan on ICE?
item.description: After nearly four days of a partial government shutdown, the House voted to temporarily continue funding the Department of Homeland Security. Was it the right move? Times Opinion’s editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, argues that Democrats’ demands are reasonable, but they risk losing momentum before the next deadline.

item.title: Vice and the Crisis of Liberalism
item.description: Is there a political prescription for our era of addiction?

item.title: What Xi’s Military Purge Means for Taiwan
item.description: His sweeping military shake-up may look like weakness, but it’s clearing the way for a more dangerous force under his full control.

item.title: Our Health Care System Isn’t Built for You to Get Old
item.description: Thousands shared their caregiving stories. Is America listening?

item.title: Are A.I. Bots Plotting a Revolution on Moltbook? Or Just Telling Stories?
item.description: A social media platform like Reddit for A.I. has taken the internet by storm. But we’re not having the right conversations about it.

item.title: Project 2028
item.description: An outline of items in a hypothetical Democratic Party platform.

item.title: Trump Is a Backlash President
item.description: We all talk about the president. Yet the presidency as a national force is disappearing, Julia Azari argues.

item.title: ICE Is Watching You
item.description: ICE knows that it cannot shoot us all. But the Department of Homeland Security is close to being able to track us all.

item.title: ‘Melania’ the Book Was Bad. ‘Melania’ the Movie Is Somehow Worse.
item.description: The surface is all there is.

item.title: Trump’s Call to ‘Nationalize’ Voting
item.description: Readers fear how far the president will go to ensure Republican victories in the midterms. Also: What it means to be a naturalized American.

item.title: Is Your Social Life Missing Something? This Conversation Is for You.
item.description: Priya Parker, the author of “The Art of Gathering,” shares her advice for orchestrating more meaningful gatherings and why that matters for our civic life, as well as our social lives.

item.title: How a Conservative Texas District Rejected the Politics of Division
item.description: Many Americans are growing both exhausted and frightened by Trump’s scorched-earth, hyperpartisan, fire-ready-aim approach to the presidency.

item.title: The Dollar Is Doing What Trump Wanted. It Might Not Work Out the Way He Imagined.
item.description: Which way is up?

item.title: These Four States Are in Denial Over a Looming Water Crisis
item.description: Colorado, New Mexico, Utah and Wyoming should let go of their thirsty aspirations and accept that the era of Western expansion is over.

item.title: Trump Isn’t Failing Because He’s Getting Bad Advice
item.description: Trump’s advisers are terrible. That’s not the problem.

item.title: Trump’s Remake of the Kennedy Center
item.description: Readers object to President Trump’s plan to close the Kennedy Center for a two-year reconstruction project. Also: U.N. financial trouble; an ominous signoff.

item.title: We Were Top Homeland Security Lawyers. You Can’t Wish Away the Fourth Amendment.
item.description: Forcibly entering homes with only administrative warrants is unconstitutional.

item.title: Bad Bunny’s High-Risk Choice: Three Opinion Writers Discuss the Grammys
item.description: There were two Grammys ceremonies: Bad Bunny’s and everyone else’s.

item.title: Want to Make a Difference? Donate Your Kidney.
item.description: We can all save a life.

item.title: What a Comparison With Roosevelt Reveals About Trump
item.description: On the limits of executive power.
